page.title: 13East Clevedon to Court Hill1
page.content: On Wednesday 17th July,class 2 of East Clevedon Primary School set out on a survey walk from All Saints Church through Court Wood to Court Hill,overlooking the M5. The wood is made up of mainly deciduous trees with a thick ground covering of ivy,ferns and bracken. The walk took us along the back of Clevedon Court.The family home of the Eltons,it is now owned by the National Trust.It has fourteenth century features including a chapel on the first floor and a fine great hall. The writer Thackeray stayed there (when it was owned by Arthur Hallam) and wrote part of "Vanity Fair"and "Henry Esmond". Walking past Clevedon Court we came to "Queen Anne Cottage".It obviously dates from the time of Queen Anne ( ).
